model

Class Admin

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Admin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Admin
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Admin class keeps a list of all usernames as String objects. There should never be more than one admin therefore it implements the singleton design pattern.
    Author:
    Kevin Cochran
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String username)
        Checks that user exists and then returns User object that was read from disk. Will create new user if disk does not contain user data or if it was corrupted.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user to look for
        Returns:
        User object

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser(java.lang.String user)
        Adds a user to the list. Will throw exception if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        user - Username to add.
        Returns:
        True if username is unique.

      • deleteUser

        public boolean deleteUser(java.lang.String user)
        Deletes user specified by the passed in string.
        Parameters:
        user - user to delete
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • renameUser

        public boolean renameUser(java.lang.String oldUser,
                          java.lang.String newUser)
        Renames user specified by the parameters
        Parameters:
        oldUser - Current username
        newUser - New username
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • writeAdmin

        public void writeAdmin()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Serialize admin and its list of usernames to 'res/admin'.

        java.io.IOException
